org.intermine.bio.postprocess

Class IntronUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.intermine.bio.postprocess.IntronUtil

  • public class IntronUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Methods for creating feature for introns.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IntronUtil

        public IntronUtil(ObjectStoreWriter osw)
        Create a new IntronUtil object that will operate on the given ObjectStoreWriter. NOTE - needs to be run after SequenceFeature.chromosomeLocation has been set.
        Parameters:
        osw - the ObjectStoreWriter to use when creating/changing objects

    • Method Detail

      • setOrganisms

        public void setOrganisms(java.lang.String organisms)
        Set a comma separated list of taxon ids to create introns for. If no list is provided introns will be created for all organisms.
        Parameters:
        organisms - a comma separated list of taxon ids

      • createIntronFeatures

        public void createIntronFeatures()
                          throws ObjectStoreException
        Create Intron objects
        Throws:
        ObjectStoreException - if there is an ObjectStore problem

      • createIntronFeatures

        protected int createIntronFeatures(java.util.Set<org.intermine.model.bio.Location> locationSet,
                       org.intermine.model.bio.SequenceFeature transcript,
                       org.intermine.model.bio.Location tranLoc,
                       org.intermine.model.bio.Gene gene)
                            throws ObjectStoreException
        Return a set of Intron objects that don't overlap the Locations in the locationSet argument. The caller must call ObjectStoreWriter.store() on the Intron, its chromosomeLocation and the synonym in the synonyms collection.
        Parameters:
        locationSet - a set of Locations for the exons on a particular transcript
        transcript - Transcript that the Locations refer to
        tranLoc - The Location of the Transcript
        gene - gene for the transcript
        Returns:
        a set of Intron objects
        Throws:
        ObjectStoreException - if there is an ObjectStore problem
